TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit SelectedDatesCollection extends System.Object implements class System.Collections.ICollection, class System.Collections.IEnumerable

Docs.summary: Encapsulates a collection of <xref:System.DateTime?displayProperty=fullName> objects that represent the selected dates in a control. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this class to programmatically manage a collection of <xref:System.DateTime?displayProperty=fullName> objects that represent the selected dates in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar> control. This class is commonly used to add or remove dates from the collection.
This collection stores only whole dates. The time portion of each <xref:System.DateTime?displayProperty=fullName> is removed. The dates are stored in ascending order. If there are duplicate dates, only one date is stored in the collection.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to programmatically use the SelectedDatesCollection class to select dates in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar> control.
[!code-vb[Classic SelectedDatesCollection Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.webcontr_331_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[Classic SelectedDatesCollection Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.webcontr_331_1.aspx)]

Docs.value: The number of <xref:System.DateTime?displayProperty=fullName> objects in the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this property to determine the number of dates in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SelectedDatesCollection> collection. The Count property is often used when iterating through the collection to determine the upper bound.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use to the Count property to determine the number of dates in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SelectedDatesCollection> collection. Note that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar.SelectedDates%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar> control is an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SelectedDatesCollection> class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Collections.IEnumerator GetEnumerator() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns an <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator?displayProperty=fullName>-implemented object that contains all <xref:System.DateTime?displayProperty=fullName> objects within the collection.
Docs.returns: An <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator?displayProperty=fullName>-implemented object that contains all <xref:System.DateTime?displayProperty=fullName> objects within the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this method to create an <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator?displayProperty=fullName>-implemented object that can be easily iterated through to get each item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SelectedDatesCollection> collection.
Use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Current%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to get the item currently pointed to in the collection.
Use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.MoveNext%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to move to the next item in the collection.
Use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Reset%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to move the enumerator back to the initial position.
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.MoveNext%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method needs to be called after creating an <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator?displayProperty=fullName>-implemented object or using the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Reset%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to move the enumerator to the first item in the collection. Otherwise, the item represented by the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Current%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is undefined.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCellCollection.GetEnumerator%2A> method to create an <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator?displayProperty=fullName>-implemented object that is iterated through to display the selected dates from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar> control.
[!code-vb[Classic SelectedDatesCollection.GetEnumerator Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.ui.webcontr_55_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[Classic SelectedDatesCollection.GetEnumerator Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.ui.webcontr_55_1.aspx)]

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the collection is read-only.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property always returns `false` to indicate that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SelectedDatesCollection> collection can be written to in all cases.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether access to the collection is synchronized (thread safe).

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is derived from <xref:System.Collections.ICollection?displayProperty=fullName> and is overridden to always return `false`.
For more information on the IsSynchronized property, see the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property of the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection?displayProperty=fullName> interface.

Docs.param: An ordinal index value that specifies which <xref:System.DateTime?displayProperty=fullName> to return.
Docs.summary: Gets a <xref:System.DateTime?displayProperty=fullName> object at the specified index in the collection.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.DateTime?displayProperty=fullName> that represents an element in the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this indexer to get an individual <xref:System.DateTime?displayProperty=fullName> object in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SelectedDatesCollection> collection at the specified index using simple array notation.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the indexer to get a <xref:System.DateTime?displayProperty=fullName> object from a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SelectedDatesCollection> collection. Note that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar.SelectedDates%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar> control is an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SelectedDatesCollection> class.

Docs.summary: Gets the object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.
Docs.value: An object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The object returned in this implementation is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SelectedDatesCollection> object itself.
For more information on the SyncRoot property, see the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.SyncRoot%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property of the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection?displayProperty=fullName> interface.
